<gallery> </gallery> {{Infobox person | name = Shelley Conn | image = | imagesize = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1976}} | birth_place = [[Barnet]], [[Greater London]], [[England]] | death_date = | death_place = | othername = | occupation = Actress | yearsactive = 2000âpresent | spouse = | domesticpartner = | website = }} '''Shelley Conn''' (born 1976) is an [[England|English]] actress.
==Early life and education== Conn was born in [[Barnet]], [[Greater London]] of British and Sri Lankan descent.{{Citation needed|date=January 2011}} The great niece of actress [[Merle Oberon]] (Oberon's brother was Conn's grandfather), Conn trained at [[Bretton Hall, West Yorkshire|Bretton Hall]]. She was a student at [[Cranbourne Business and Enterprise College|Cranbourne School]], [[Basingstoke]] [[Hampshire]].
==Personal life== Conn lives in London and dates fellow ''Mersey Beat'' and ''Casualty'' actor [[Jonathan Kerrigan]].<ref name=autogenerated1 /><ref>[http://www.holby.tv/db/index.php?id=38,200,0,0,1,0 holby.tv | Casualty | Jonathan Kerrigan<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Conn ran in the 2006 [[London Marathon]].<ref>[http://www.london-marathon.co.uk/site/media_centre/pdf/media_pack/celebs_and_politicians.pdf]{{dead link|date=September 2011}}</ref>
==Career== After drama school, Conn had a series of bit-parts in various British films, before coming to prominence in Series Five of the popular [[BBC One]] series ''[[Down to Earth (UK TV series)|Down to Earth]]''. In 2001, she picked up the role of PC Miriam Da Silva in BBC1's ''[[Merseybeat (TV series)|Mersey Beat]]'' and an irregularly recurring role in ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' - both of which starred her current boyfriend, [[Jonathan Kerrigan]].
In 2002, Conn made her [[West End theatre]] stage debut in three plays in December 2002, after transferring from [[Stratford-upon-Avon]] in the [[Royal Shakespeare Company]]'s Jacobean Season at the [[Gielgud Theatre]] - ''The Island Princess'', ''Eastward Ho!'' and ''The Roman Actor''.<ref name=autogenerated1>[http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4153/is_20021211/ai_n12024073]{{dead link|date=September 2011}}</ref>
Conn has now developed her roles between all three media (television, film and theatre), with a series of leading roles in various small budget [[Europe]]an as well as British films; BBC character dramas such as ''[[The Innocence Project (BBC TV Series)|The Innocence Project]]''; and occasional returns to the RSC.
Conn starred as Ashika Chandiramani in the [[BBC]] series ''[[Party Animals (TV series)|Party Animals]]''.
In early 2008, Conn starred as Miranda Hill in ''[[The Palace]]'', as Jessica in ''[[Mistresses (TV series)|Mistresses]]'' and as Neela Sahjani in ''[[Trial & Retribution]]''.
In 2009 she appeared as Claire in ''[[Dead Set (TV series)|Dead Set]]''.
In 2010 she played Danni Prendiville in the TV series ''[[Strike Back (TV series)|Strike Back]]''.
She was chosen by [[Steven Spielberg]] to be one of the leads in his new $150 million TV series [[Terra Nova (TV series)|''Terra Nova'']], which premiered September 26th, 2011.<ref>[http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/news/spielberg-picks-new-leading-lady-from-wards-of-casualty-2094579.html "Spielberg picks new leading lady from wards of 'Casualty'"] Retrieved on 2010-10-02</ref>
